CatDescriptText: Thelma Blasingame, cosmetologist, 4283 Dakota Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "We should receive one-half from a graduated income tax and half from an increased sales tax. The division should be made so that no one group would bear the burden of supporting the operations of the state."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Blasingame wearing light colored coat with wide lapels, light colored hat and gloves, and eyeglasses, standing in front of building
